column3:
ACK
My nodes get flooded with these 2 year old spam transactions after every block:
[27cdfec78b2e0e97762a8486d5440bfc02dac3c2cd278ac803b81062c7212332](https://www.blocktrail.com/BTC/tx/27cdfec78b2e0e97762a8486d5440bfc02dac3c2cd278ac803b81062c7212332)

Concept ACK.  

Is it worth warning users of the parameter interaction if they are setting `-relaypriority=0`?

> Is it worth warning users of the parameter interaction if they are setting -relaypriority=0?\n\nSuggestions welcome, but I am not sure if this is required. I understand the relaypriority setting is orthogonal to the limitfreerelay setting. If the user set `-relaypriority=0` today, they'd still see their transaction rate limited (with 15 kB/min). So when they depend on free relay, they most likel
@luke-jr Sorry, but we're planning to remove priority. It is no longer useful to maintain.\n
@sipa It remains useful and used. NACK removing it from mining.
NACK. There is no plan to remove priority transactions, only "smart priority" attempting to use it. Don't confuse priority with gratis txns... they are different.\n
